intro: Phialanthus peduncularis, commonly known as the African star报花, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers that resemble stars, which bloom in spring. The plant has a woody stem and produces small, green, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for cultivation in arid or semi-arid regions. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
